text: hi guys you know how you go to those
fancy stores and you're like I want to
buy that hot cocoa mix it looks so good
and you pick it up and it's like I don't

mix and you can make a whole bunch of it
and just keep it in a canister in your
house to make this mix you only need
three ingredients sugar three and a half
cups I'm putting it through sieve but
you don't need to strain the sugar it's
actually for the cocoa powder which is
what comes next
you need two and a quarter cups of cocoa
powder I'm using a really nice Dutch
process cocoa the flavor of your cocoa
is going to depend on the flavor of your
cocoa powder so make sure that you get a
good one for this so I'm passing this
through sieve to remove the lumps
because the lumpiness is not going to be
great when you add it to your milk so
get it as unlucky as possible and then
when you mix it with the sugar it won't
get as lumpy as it does when it's on its
own set that aside and then you need to
season it was a tablespoon of table salt
now you know I usually use coarse salt
but in this case I want to use table
salt because I want it to dissolve very
quickly in the milk when I'm making it
into hot cocoa so use table salt in this
instance doesn't that look rich and
delicious if you want to do
mocha hot chocolate add some instant
espresso powder to your mix this is
instant espresso you could use two or
three tablespoons just to add it right
in maybe even a quarter cup you want to
have something like a little bit of a
Mexican hot chocolate mix you could add
some cinnamon maybe about a tablespoon
of ground cinnamon for this amount this
is gonna make lots of cups of hot cocoa
because you only need about two
tablespoons of your cocoa mix for every
cup of hot milk so heat your milk and do
